metadata.titel_preek: On the Palms of God’s Hands

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God restores and remembers His people (Zion) despite their exile, internal decay, and feelings of abandonment.

tekstueel_bewijs: I have inscribed you on the palms of my hands.
He has the power to do those good things.
God... sent his only Son to offer himself as a living sacrifice.

object.identificatie: The restoration and preservation of the Church/Zion
tekstueel_bewijs: The walls of the church are ever before him.
The promises made to the church are based in the faithfulness of God.

ontvanger.identificatie: Zion / The Church (The community of believers)
tekstueel_bewijs: The promises of God are not made to individuals existing in isolation... They are made to a community.

helper.identificatie: The Prophet (Isaiah), Jesus Christ (as sacrifice), and the 'Builders' (human agents used by God)
tekstueel_bewijs: He intends to use you as builders.
Sent his only Son to offer himself as a living sacrifice.
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who also provides the Helper (Christ).
helper.rol_van_geest: External help/Indwelling power ('pour out his Spirit upon the church').

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Death, Exile, and 'Destroyers' (internal and external threats)
tekstueel_bewijs: The church is full of those who would destroy it with sin and selfishness.
Fallen into sin and become subject to evil and death.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but the 'grave of human hopes' and 'evil and death' which only God can conquer.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The congregation (builders) participating in the upkeep and growth of the local church.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearers (The Congregation)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics/building) is explicitly stated as a result of God's primary action (soteriology). God 'intends to use you' because He has already 'inscribed you'.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God chooses to compare his love.
He has the power to do those good things.
The One who has demonstrated his power to raise the dead.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Every one of us has at one time or another offended.
We can therefore find some common thread.
Each of us is able to make a contribution.

voorbeelden: How do we know that? How can we be sure?
He has the power to do those good things.
Only God can conquer the sorrows and evils of this world.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'Being Able' (Pouvoir) in the face of human 'Inability'. This is a hallmark of grace-oriented homiletics.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from S2 (Exile/Forgotten) through ~S1 (the reality of the 'Destroyers' in the church) to S1 (God's ontological commitment to remember).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God's 'mighty hand' which inscribes the people on His palms, making S1 permanent regardless of ~S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. The sermon does not shy away from the 'hard, dark road' or the 'grave of human hopes'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the active Subject of salvation. Human action is framed as a secondary response to a divine reality already established.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Each of us is able to make a contribution to the upbuilding.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He has the power to do those good things.
The promises made to the church are based in the faithfulness of God.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Isaiah is used as a witness to God's action, not a moral hero to imitate. The 'builders' are functional roles, not models of virtue.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and security; shifting focus from self-performance to God's faithfulness.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic preservation: God keeps the church.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from God's promise (Soteriology) to the congregation's work (Ethics) is perfectly ordered.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Sent his only Son to offer himself as a living sacrifice.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: High; sin is seen as a 'destroyer' that only God can outdo.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a textbook example of theocentric narrative. God is the Subject, the Church is the Receiver, and human effort is a 'Helper' role derived from the Subject's power.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it serves the 'despair' context well.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon masterfully avoids the trap of 'exemplarism' by making the palm-inscription an ontological act of God rather than a reward for human building.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis might focus on the 'mother' imagery; Greimassian analysis shows that the image functions to establish God as the permanent Subject/Sender.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the context of Second Isaiah; semiotics shows how that context creates a 'lack' that only a Divine Subject can fill.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'builders' (the congregation) are actantially 'Helpers' to God's primary program, preventing the sermon from becoming a mere 'volunteer recruitment' speech.

volledige_subject_lijst: God (chooses, speaks, compares, loves, promises, causes, creates, sends, uses, inscribes)
appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Rutledge Rule' effectively by attributing the 'outdoing' of destroyers to the promise of God rather than the skill of the builders.
